Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, right in the centre of historical Rome. It is on the same road as the Spanish Steps, Piazza del Popolo is at the end of the road, the Trevi and Trion fountains are within a 5 min walk and the Pantheon is no more than a 15min walk. The hotel is very basic but met our needs for a short city break. The bed was comfortable but there were no tea or coffee making facilities available. There is an instruction in the room asking you not to change the settings on the air conditioning as it is set to the correct setting and if you change it then it may not work anymore which was a bit strange. The en suite was fine, however there was a little bit of damp above the shower and the water just poured out of the shower like a tap rather than like a normal shower, but this was fine for just a few nights. Breakfast was disappointing. It is just a croissant, crusty bread roll and cracker bread with a selection of butter, jam, honey and hazelnut chocolate spread which got very boring. I also found it quite strange that you have to leave your key with reception when you go out for the day, you are not allowed to take it with you. This wouldn't be too much of a problem but when you return and ask for your key, they don't even ask you for your name to check that you are the person staying in that room. Also, there is no safety deposit box in the room. However, I found this hotel great value for money in terms of location and would go back for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but does not offer what they advertise.”
Reviews.Author: Pure_diversion
Reviews.Content: I had been in touch with Hotel Doge the day before our arrival to explain that we would be checking in late. I was assured by a member of staff in writing there would be no problem. Upon arriving at Hotel Doge the following evening by taxi, very late in the evening, we were told that we were booked in another hotel without any explanation nor apology. What really bothered me about this experience was that I find it not only impolite, but quite frankly "dodgy" that a "hotel" would wait until its guests arrived at 12.30 a.m., before telling them they have been moved to another hotel. They could have also contacted us with a simply phone call as they had this information but it is certain they simply don´t care. You should also be advised that you will not be staying at anything closely resembling what Hotel "Dodgy" pictures on its website. Concerning the rooms, well when I opened the curtains, I was greeted with small pieces of falling plaster on my head and the bathroom was a freezer, no heating, with mold growing on the window panes. I must admit the shower was clean and the beds were miraculously neat and comfortable but that is the best I can say about this hotel. Don´t expect anything from this place besides a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you don't mind sleeping in a broom cupboard”
Reviews.Author: Fran P
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the location of the hotel - 5 minute walk from Metro, Spanish steps and Trevi fountain, with loads of shops and restuarants near by. We stayed in a twin room that just about had room for two small single beds. There were no plug sockets that worked apart from the one the TV was plugged into so constantly had to unplug the TV. The beds were not flat, felt like I was going to fall out of it because it was tipped on one side no matter what I did. The bathroom was tiny and had mould growing in the corner of the shower which caused it to stink (the filter was full of gunk!) The shower, as well as being extremely small, took 5 minutes of running before the water came through luke warm and then only came out as a dribble. The walls in the room were extremely thin and half painted and the wallpaper was ripped and very old in the corridors. The choice of breakfast was good but again was set out in a tiny room with not enough tables for all of the people staying at the hotel. The breakfast staff were extremely rude to us and told us that we couldn't have tea because they hadn't turned the machine on yet and how can we expect to have tea as breakfast has only been open for 20 minutes... Would never go back to this hotel but will look for one in a similar location.

Reviews.Title: “A tiny little gem right in the heart of Historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: 3stars1wish
Reviews.Content: Hotel Doge was a tiny little hotel right in the Heart of the Historic District of Rome, within walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and so much more. We stayed in a double room, which had a double bed, matching draperies and bedspread, clean 4 piece bath including: toilet, bidette, shower and sink. The towels looked like huge dishtowels, but really did an excellent job of drying off after a shower. Basic toiletries were provides. Breakfast was continental: bread, butter and spreads, croissants, coffee, hot chocolate, and juice. This was much appreciated! Our daughters stayed in a room with 3 twin beds. Their room was old and rather shabby - perhaps it could use a little rennovation - but it was clean. We did notice workers with supplies working on some of the rooms. Our hotel was quite old and actually had 2 name plaques on it - Hotel Doge and Hotel Florence, perhaps there is a difference in the rooms in each of the "2" hotels. Point to note - be prepared to use the stairs. There is a lift - I think it went up 2 floors, but it can only hold 1 person and 1 large suitcase! Hotel staff was helpful, and courteous. They provided us with a city map, gave us directions, ordered us a taxi when we were leaving, and held our bags until we departed. Excellent value for the price we paid! Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: wendy c
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Doge in Rome for 4 days. The hotel is in need of a complete facelift or major renno! The reception staff were lovely and helpful. The breakfast staff were terrible, everything was too much trouble! They expected you to eat off the paper place mats. I always asked for a bread and butter plate. The rooms were grubby and our linen wasnt changed for the 4 days we were there, they also have the worst towels..like tea towels. I dont know if they work short staffed or what. The one saving grace for this establishment is the location it is fabulous close to everything. W & D

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jsweat
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Doge (which also includes Hotel Firenze - we couldn't figure out the difference) was very conveniently located to many of the tourist attractions in Rome and to the Metro. We have a great stay and the staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Very Average-Poor Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set up as if it is an apartment building converted into a hotel. Every floor is separated by dingy flights of stairs and concrete walls. We were put into a room that had one double bed rather than two single beds (which we requested) and the entire room smelled of smoke. We requested to move rooms and the staff immediately switched us to much more spacious and nicer room. Our new room was huge with better air conditioning and no smell of smoke. The decor was very old-school and dated but other than that the room was adequate. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and answered all of our questions as well as giving us lots of tips of where to go and how to navigate. The hotel was in a great location: Very close to the Trevi Fountain (10 minute walk) and the Spanish Steps (5 minute walk) which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: FintonCorkIreland
Reviews.Content: Not worthy of the name 'Hotel' more like a very poor hostel. Lift not working. Filthy hotel. No lounge to sit in. No ice available. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you are after a good location rather than a flash hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nz_shez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location was fantastic, I think it would be hard to find such a well priced hotel in a similar location. Our room was pretty basic and no frills but it did the job and the bed was comfortable. It was very noisy due to the main street below. The service at this hotel is non-existent and the breakfast (don't bother). It only consists of a croissant in a packet, some cornflakes and dried bread rolls. Our room was up a shared staircase so anyone from the street could have walked up. There was no wifi and we found finding wifi elsewhere very difficult in rome. As long as you are after location over hotel amenities and are expecting a no frills experience this hotel will be a good base in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; rooms are better than the rest of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: OceanCloud
Reviews.Content: It is very hard to find a conveniently located hotel in Rome for an affordable price. Hotel Doge certainly fit that bill but we were concerned of what we would find there. The location is indeed fantastic, no more than 5 minutes walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Piazza di Spagna (Spanish Steps). When we checked in, we were too early and the front desk staff, who could have been friendlier, told us to leave our luggage in the adjoining room. The room already had quite a few suitcases and was not secured at all. In fact, we were left all alone in there with other guests' suitcases. Not reassuring. After a great lunch nearby, we returned and our room was ready. The elevator is tiny and is definitely not recommended for anyone with any remote trace of claustrophobia! We decided to throw our bags in it, push the button and race it upstairs... all the way to the 4th floor... We would come to dread these stairs! The room was small, but the bed was reasonably comfortable. It featured air conditioning and a window with a view of balconies of people's apartments. The bathroom was immaculate and a bit larger than usual european downtown hotels. Breakfast was included and was pretty basic. A roll and some pre-packaged pastries, but the cappuccino was decent. With a little work to restore and repaint the walls in the common areas and the stairs, this hotel would look a lot better. Of course, it's pretty basic, but the price is reasonable, and the location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Don't sacrifice a good nights sleep for location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adniymeon
Reviews.Content: The room is not like it's pictured in the advertisement! One thing i really took into consideration after booking this room for the rest of my 2 week European trip is "DON'T SACRIFICE A GOOD NIGHTS SLEEP FOR LOCATION & TO SAVE $20-$30!! The rooms are old, musty smell, carpet is filthy with stains, didn't even want to walk on it without shoes. Comforters looked really old & worn out! Bed was really hard, only reason I slept all night on the uncomfortable bed is because I took a sleeping pill. The staff is friendly, but not very mindful of people that light up a cigarette in their office, they just comment "It's supposed to be no smoking, (while smirking, oh well)" & never say to the customer NO SMOKING! Breakfast sucks!!!! Kitchen Staff rude!!!! If you just eat biscuits with coffee for breakfast, than you'll love it. Don't sacrifice a goods night sleep to save $30, cause you'll dread the next day out in Rome. It is less than 10 minute walk from fontana di Trevi though & less than 8 mins from Spanish steps opposite direction. (only really good thing is close proximity to those 2 attractions, some shops, metro & free internet access (in the lobby area). 1-2 stars hotel**

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, needs better heating!”
Reviews.Author: Emily123London
Reviews.Content: Totally positive about this hotel: - great location - clean rooms and bathrooms - friendly staff - value for money (although watch the extra charge for room tax!) - good breakfast My only complaint is that the room was very cold at times as the heater in the room was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very close to all sites”
Reviews.Author: TheJJFishes
Reviews.Content: I went with my mum and thouroughly enjoyed every experience. The hotel was easy to find, attached to another The Firenze, Receptionist very helpful. It was strangly set out but the room on the 1st floor was big enough for the both of us. It actually had 3 beds in. Very clean, apart from a stain on the carpet. The bathroom was very clean too. We arrived around 2.00 literally went up to our rooms and then went out, turned a corner and the Trevi Fountain was in front of us. We went past it every day and night, spectacular view back to the hotel. All the other sites are withing walking distance even the Vatican and the Colleseum. The breakfast was upstairs and it was basic, cereal with rolls and croissants in a basket on the table with jams and butter, with coffee and juice, this was all served by two/three waitresses. If you want a plate, ask, they will give you one, otherwise just use the throw away paper they lay on the table, everyone else did. You can ask for as much coffee as you like. The room looked out on the street, noisy if you left the window open but quite during the night, in the morning the horse and traps clip clopped past our window to go to the spanish steps, it was lovely. All in all we had a lovely stay in Rome, we did not really spend a lot of time in the hotel, just slept there and showered each morning. But I would recommend this Hotel even though the web site is very much exaggerated.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but not for Sheraton afficiandos”
Reviews.Author: RodMac
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel when in Rome. But, if you are a typical North American traveller, you have to alter your expectations. What I am looking for is a clean room and a private bath; I spend very little time in my hotel and have little need of all the useless amenities. This hotel is in an excellent location. Just a few metres from the Spanish Steps and an easy walk to the Trevi Fountain and many other Roman landmarks, easy access to Metro stations Spagna and Barbarini. This hotel was recommended to me years ago by an Italian friend and personally, I swear by it. The rooms are small...this is not unique in Europe! They are clean. The breakfast is basic...juice, coffee and breads. But the last thing I want to spend my travel budget on is a hotel, I'm never there. As for the towels, that a previous reviewer complained about: anyone I have taken there has found them intriguing. They aren't terry...more like table linens; but they are absorbant and clean and do the job they were intended for quite well, thank you! It's just a very minute detail that adds colourfully to the travel experience. As for having to ask for shampoo; I certainly would expect to bring my own when staying in a one star hotel. Like my header line says, this ain't the Sheraton- I'm glad its not!!! It is exceptionally good value, but if you expect champagne at beer prices; you are setting yourself up for disappointment and that isn't the hotels fault; you are just an idiot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: SharleenE3
Reviews.Content: Great Location, 5 mins from Spanish Steps and 5-10 mins from Trevi Fountain, Via Vento with its nice restaurents/bars was 10 min walk, All the sights were within walking distance. The hotel is just a lobby with a bad staircase to an average room, but the price is cheap and if all you want is to see the sights in a good location or for a good price then this isn't a bad choice. The staff were friendly but be prepared,the lift is small and old and you can hear alot of noise (People, building work etc..)from the room, but again great location...6/10

Reviews.Title: “Not Palace at All”
Reviews.Author: yellowfire
Reviews.Content: I dissapointed with the hotel from the first minute I got in. To get in the floor sections, the stair and the corridors were very dirty, full of dump, it was like to be abandoned. In the floor section where our room was, as soon as you opened the door, the carpet smelt mold. In our room the toilet seat was broken and after a shower you had to wait 15-20 minutes for the water to be absorbed. The breakfast was awful, cold coffee and very small variety. Last but not least it was impossible to contact by phone the reception. They never answered the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: dancinpet
Reviews.Content: Upon check in they showed us to our room, which was on the 1st floor-I noticed that the hallway light wasn't working during the day-total omen of the bad things to come. The hallway light did not work at all! It was very dangerous at night trying to get to our room, we had to use our cell phones as flashlights. The room was dirty (stained walls and bedspreads) and totally unsafe-exposed wires in the room and the bathroom. We slept in the room one night- when we tried to get a refund (which was not happening-I talked to both workers and then the manager/owner) we finally got them to give us 2 new rooms (1 for the girls and the guy got a separate room-which worked out well). But they were horrible about the whole thing-after I repeatedly told them our room was dirty and unsafe. The final straw was on the last night as we were sleeping in our LOCKED room around 2am, someone (I am assuming a hotel worker) opened our door! I woke up right away in a panic, they said sorry and closed the door. When I went down the next morning to report the incident they told me there was no way that could have happened, and then after I became very upset they asked me why didn't I come down right away and tell them.........

Reviews.Title: “The Doge - Basic, but clean. Convenient location. Worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: JhyT
Reviews.Content: Although we managed to walk straight past the entrance, it is on an easy to find street. Very close to the Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain and all the other major sights. This is a cheap, basic and simple hotel, don't expect anything else. The breakfast was simple. If your looking for a cheap hotel, that is still close to all the sights, this is a good choice. Weirdly set out, it shares a reception with another hotel, The Firenze, and is situated on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good experience”
Reviews.Author: tweedheads
Reviews.Content: Had a double room booked at Hotel Doge due to its location and that really liked the look of the rooms on any websites on the internet. When we checked in, instead of a double we were allocated a triple room (with 3 single beds, not even 1 double + 1 single). We cut cut the thick/heavy smoke in the room with a nife and opening the window and door didn't help to get rid of it at all. The room was filfthy, no internet service as advertised, stains and holes on the dirty carpet and only 1 very dim light working. Not at all a room that we had confirmed and not to one bit it looked the standard ones pictured on any websites, even on the hotel's itself. The whole place in real life looks really dodgy itself. Myself working in travel, I was pretty much disappointed in the fact that the room and service advertised on the hotel's and other websites was not even close to what they offer. But was even more shocked by the managements attitude they ahd towards us. Went to hotel reception to ask for another room, but were refused immediately, yet offering us a spray to get rid of the smoke in the room which, of course, didn't help at all. Called the supplier we booked the room through, was advised to check-out immediately and get contact details of person at reception as a reference in order to lodge an official complaint. We did so, but were refused to be given a name, and when after a big hassle we talked to the hotel manager on the phone, she was very rude to us refusing to give us her name immediately not even wanting to deal with any of the issues we had. We checked out, and final 3 hours later found another hotel at the Spanish steps that offers hotel rooms as well as apartments in the next street. We opted for the apartment which had a really good price (EUR 87.00 a night). An accommodation which we can recommend to everyone given its cleanliness, location and the very friendly and always helpful service of the hotel staff and management. his place is called HOTEL CONDOTTI or the apartments are CONDOTTI PALACE APARTMENTS. Attached a few photos to show what a difference there is between Hotel Doge and the Condotti palace Apartments for about the same price. And we are not at all for luxury when it comes to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Central - Nice people - A hotel in the backyard”
Reviews.Author: Vespasian_II
Reviews.Content: Very close to everything! But a strange place. Though: Hotels in Rome are expensive and this was after all a good choise for us. Close to Spanish Steps and Trevi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations, impecabble maid service, and a great location”
Reviews.Author: TnC_NYC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Doge is otherwise known as Firenze Palace. The entrance is through a small corridor, which is unlike traditional hotels. The elevator is indeed small, and I think one side of the building houses private apartments, but the hotel section and our room were a pleasant surprise. We stayed at room# 302. It was a pretty decent size room by European city standards. The bathroom was completely renovated, tile everywhere and a new shower door. The Air Conditioner was new and in perfect working order. There was an LCD TV mounted on the wall. The view outside the windows was to the back of another building, not much of a view but who cares when all the beautiful sights of Rome are outside and most within walking distance from this hotel! The staff was friendly and the maid service impeccable, they kept the room spotless! One of the best parts is that they serve breakfast in the room, at no additional charge, at whichever time you tell them in the morning; what a treat! The location of the hotel was great. We walked all the way from Piazza Del Popolo, which is a few blocks away from the hotel, to the Campidoglio, and everywhere in between. The train station, Termini, is only a couple of stops away on the Metro (but we took our luggage with us on the 110 OPEN bus which goes around several main sites and got off at the station which is the starting and end point for the tour so we didn't have to lug the stuff up and down stairs on the Metro). Overall, this is a great hotel and we would definitely recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Central, good value for money, with airconditioning and fridge”
Reviews.Author: CherCleo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the same street as the spanish steps. It is just a few mins away from the metro, thus if you are looking for a bugdet holiday, it is in a central location where one is able to walk to all the central parts of rome. The room on first impression is not very nice, however the airconditioning is in good order, you have the control so you can change it according to your needs. The breakfast is delivered in the bedroom, and this is good cos if you want to eat it with anything else than what they give you you are able to buy from a supermarket that is very close. There was a fridge in the room with a small freezer that although not is perfect order, was good enough to keep things cold. Whoever does not understand italian, may have a problem with the tv as all the channels are in italian. It wasn't a prob for us! The room given to us was huge, we had a double room with ample space to move, it was facing the outside of the building, however there is double glazing, and we could never hear anything from the outside. Very glad to have booked the hotel as it had all the amenties needed and at the same time was very central. For the money I spent 95 Euros per night for bed and breakfast we had a very good deal in the central part of rome There is an internet cafe just round the corner for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by it's cover”
Reviews.Author: adevries
Reviews.Content: The entrance to the hotel doesn't look very nice and you have to go up the stairs or take a very strange little elevator to go to your room, but the room we stayed in was just lovely. It was a double room, very clean and new. A large bathroom, and even a private balcony. The location is also perfect for sightseeing as you can walk anywhere. The breakfast could have been better. Since there is no breakfastroom, it is brought up to your room and this means you are limited in choosing what you eat, and especially how much you eat. Our appitites were decidedly bigger than the breakfast brought up to us. Still, it's a very relaxing way to start your day having breakfast in bed. The staff was very friendly and provided us with maps and other information about the city. This hotel was at or over the top end of our budget, but a great stay if you're going to spend a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Super Incredible Room – More Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: wisconsinromefan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at the Doge in Rome. It was terrific. The staff was super friendly and extremely helpful. Our room and bath were very very clean and fresh sheets/towels/soaps/shampoos/ were always provided. The delightful breakfast was delivered everyday by a cheerful person. There is some remodeling in the hallways and what looked like some future dining areas – none of which bothered us in any way. The location is great for everything you want to see. Wonderful gelato store two doors down! The only thing we missed was a wireless connection – but there is an internet cafe a block away.

Reviews.Title: “If you care ONLY for the location.....”
Reviews.Author: Spyros S
Reviews.Content: I must say first of all that I had to stay in Doge. My wife joined a group of Italian learning students from Greece, (including the teachers,an Italian from Bologna and his Greek girlfriend).As a group,they managed to get good prices in their destinations(Venezia,Firenze and finally Rome-doge hotel). The plan was to join them in Rome.The result was to stay in a double room during the high season of the hotel and give 140!! euros(normal internet price for the excact period was 180!!!,but we had that reduction as almost part of the group. What i want to say is that i wouldn't book that hotel as an individual.From what i realised,searching on the internet,in Rome you pay first of all the location. Doge is (self)called a three star hotel.I tried very hard to find some of those in our room,in the coridors,in the breakfast room. Consider that for 4 days we had the same towels!!! Going there I had the feeling that we are giving a lot of money, staying there I realised that we were giving a lot of money for a ...hostel. If you can get a good price through a travel operation doge is in a very convinient position. But if you only can book it via internet don't think of it

Reviews.Title: “Fire Hazard: Hotel Doge”
Reviews.Author: romeo1ny
Reviews.Content: 1- Hotel reception desk is not as pictures show it. It is on ground floor and does not look anything like that. 2- Entrance gate has broken glass to which you need to stick your hand through, yes through, to unlock the gate. 3- The amount of exposed wiring in the building is unbeliveable as well as a major fire hazard. 4-There is NOT a single smoke detector ANYWHERE. 5- There is no iron/board, laundrey service. I could get by all the negatives, except the fire hazards, for which I will not return to that hotel this summer. It truly is a shame, as the staff is friendly and the rooms are clean and it has a great location. The FDNY would close the place PRONTO !

Reviews.Title: “There were some problems...”
Reviews.Author: Kangor
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Hotel Doge. It is not one of the best hotels we've seen in Italy -- the walls of the room were dirty, the A/C released water into a plastic bottle multiple times in the middle of the night. You can not open the window because there is building opposite and the street is veery noisy. The entry to the hotel is just disgusting. Can't they fix their old pinboards at the entry? Lift.....hmm if you can call it lift. It is smelly little box half way between first and second floor. So if you have a room at the first floor don't bother. Bathroom- I had a problem to squise between the sink and the wall. If you are over 90kg you might find that you will not be able to use the shower. TV is very old and the bed is cover with oversize matterace so during the night you feel that you can slide. But looks big. Overall we going back to Rome on our way back but found another hotel in the nearby area (same price but much better)

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: trinity29
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 night stay at this hotel.If you are looking for location, then this is the best place to stay.The reception staff were very friendly and helpful.Same cant be said for the breakfast serving lady who was very grumpy but that was just a minor inconvenience.You can walk to all the major tourist attractions from this hotel.The metro is 5 minutes walk away and also plenty of places to eat around the area.If you are looking for a plush hotel then this is not the place to stay.But if you are looking for fantastic location and a place to rest your head at night,then this is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ruin your trip to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Italella
Reviews.Content: I've booked this hotel a few days ago (after reading multiple reviews on this site) and stayed there for a night with my family. It is one of the worst hotels we've seen in Italy -- the walls of the room were dirty, the A/C released water in a plastic barrel multiple times in the middle of the night and there was mold in the bathroom. Despite the fact that we're in the middle of a hot summer, the hotel could not sell us a bottle of water (they 'ran out of stock a few days ago'). If you want to enjoy Rome and always remember its charm, please do not stay at this place. I'm not sure who's reviewing it and giving it high grades...My advice: Don't stay there. It's not worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: 302310barcelona
Reviews.Content: I would suggest this hotel, because it is in a very good location and because it is very clean. Be aware, that it is on the 2nd and 3rd floor of the building, which surprised me at first. For me it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, newly remodeled, clean”
Reviews.Author: lmdima33
Reviews.Content: We made very last minute reservations at the Doge and got a very nice room for 150 euros. The elevator was broken so we had to carry our heavy bags up many stairs but the room was very recently renovated with new tile and new furniture. It smelled new and clean. Air conditioning is extra but we didn't need it. You can't been the location of this hotel. We never took a cab and walked everywhere: Colosseum, Piazza Navona. Spanish Steps, Camp de Fiori. Trevi Fountain. We booked Carani tours for a tour of the Vatican and Sistine Chapel and it was well worth the 57 euro. I highly recommend this hotel and location for a 3 star under 200 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for price.”
Reviews.Author: cavanking
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Hotel basic but hence the price.Very clean and great location and would return no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelbuga
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location near the Spanish Steps. The front desk staff were extremely helpful but the breakfast serving staff was awful. The breakfast room was always very quiet because the woman serving had a terrible attitude. The breakfast was minimal with sweet buns, coffee, tea, packaged toasts with nutella. The server would be guarding her sweet bun basket and making sure that everyone only took one!! Our room was very clean and the linens were changed every other day. The hotel is located on 2 floors with the front reception (and some rooms) on the second floor and some more rooms were on the 4th floor. Our room was located on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: SW2
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Doge. The location is excellent, a short walk from the Metro station, the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain and reasonable walking distance to all other major attractions. I had a single room on the 4th floor to the rear of the building which was quiet. It had obviously been recently refurbished including new shower room. The room was cleaned and towels replaced daily. The staff are very friendly and offered to organise taxi transfers for me when I booked. However, the location makes the Terravision bus and a 2 stop Metro ride very painless. Only one word of warning, there isn't a lift - still that makes you feel less guilty about all the ice creams!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Doge
HotelInfo.Address: Via Due Macelli 106, 00187 Rome, Italy
